text: hi this is Seema and today I'm going to
bring you a new lesson on expressions
using the very common word hot well we
all know that the word hot refers to the
temperature the weather but when you
combine this word with other words you
can use this word as an expression to
talk about various things and that would
really improve your English so let's see
what they are okay the first one is hot
line okay
the word hot line refers to I'm going to
draw a telephone or something that looks
like a receiver okay because it refers
to a line a telephone line basically
which gives you quick and direct access
to any kind of help or information so if
you want some help or if you want some
information and if you want some quick
and direct line or a telephone number to
get access to help or information then
that's what a hot line is do you know
some hot lines I do well for example in
America you've got CPS which is called
the child protection services that is a
hotline that you call if you feel like
some children are not being treated very
well where I live
we've got something called as the book
by show it's it's a movie hotline which
helps you book your movies in advance
you also have something called is 911
this is an ambulance service when
someone is hurt or wounded you call this
number okay so that's what the hotline
is alright moving on to
the next expression using the word hot
is the word hot bed well imagine if you
sleep in a bed that is really hot that
would get very comfortable right but
that's not what this word really means a
hot bed basically refers to a place
which allows something or some people to
grow and develop fully so let's take an
example ok if I say my company or the
organization that I work for is a hotbed
of innovation I basically I'm trying to
tell you that the place that I work for
provides the right inputs the right
materials for people to innovate people
to come up with creative ideas so we
might reward people who come with a good
idea to help sales grow or we might give
special cash incentives for people who
come with something really brilliant so
a hot bed is nothing but a place wherein
a person or a thing or an idea can grow
and develop fully ok then we've got the
next one which is hot shot ok a hot shot
basically refers to a person who is very
successful and mostly these people who
are successful are quite arrogant about
it so we have a successful arrogant
person who is referred to as a hot shot
so you could say something like the
actress is she's a hot shot actress who
came into fame after airing in a reality
show so some people who get successful
quite fast and who are quite arrogant
about that they are called hot shots ok
and the next one is hot-headed okay now
um when your head feels hot then that is
one way of saying that you are
angry so a hot-headed person reference
to someone who is easily angered so if
you've had very strict parents who got
easily angry at you as a child you could
say something like my parents were very
hot-headed as a child so I was very
scared to tell them things about what
I've done for the day because they were
easily angered
they were very hot-headed okay and the
next one is hot cakes well we all love
to have hot cakes but we're not talking
about something that we can eat we're
not talking about a dessert hot cakes as
an English expression can also refer to
and you know a product which is selling
very fast because it has gained a lot of
popularity so when the new iPhone is
launched in September in most cases it
sells like hotcakes which means that it
is a product that sells very fast owing
to it being very popular okay and the
next expression we're going to talk
about is hot spot now hot spot is one
word but it can mean two different
things okay a hot spot could mean a very
popular place and people normally if you
know visit so say a nightclub could be a
hot spot say a coffee shop could be a
hot spot these are very popular places
that people visit or a tourist place of
some sort but a hot spot can also be an
area where there is a lot of violence
and conflict
I'm not sure if you are aware about the
strip of Gaza where there is always a
lot of violence a lot of conflict that
is a hot spot so you're not supposed to
go in those areas because it's very
prone to violence it's very prone to
conflict so there are two ways to use
the word hotspot depending on what you
want to convey to the person you are
talking to okay let's look at the other
set of expressions using the word hot
we've got hot-button issues okay issues
relate to situations things
controversies but what are hot-button
issues any issues or topics which make
people very angry very emotional very
passionate those are called hot-button
issues so if you get angry or emotional
or extremely passionate talking about
something you know that that topic is a
hot-button issue can you think of
something like that
I can well say talks about sexuality
these days it is a hot-button issue
talks about vegetarianism should I eat
vegetables should I eat meat that is
again a very hot button issue abortion
is another hot-button issue religion
again is another hot-button issues
because when you talk about that people
tend to get very passionate yeah that's
how that's what we call a hot-button
issue and now moving on to the next one
we've got hot off the press if anything
is hot off the press we're talking about
a book or any kind of thing that is
published it could be a newspaper it
could be a magazine anything that is
just released or that is recently
released so you can say something like I
love reading the game of Thrones
I'm going to buy the next book when it
comes hot off the press which means that
as soon as it is
least you're going to buy it from
whatever you want to buy it from okay
that's what it means to be hot off the
press the next one is full of hot air
okay there are some people who are full
of hot air okay so this is an expression
that we use to talk about when we're
referring to people but who are these
people who are full of hot air there are
people who talk nonsense and these
people can't be taken seriously so if
you're talking to a person who keeps
talking things that you don't like or
talks about things that are not relevant
to you you know that that person can't
be taken seriously so that person is
full of hot air that's how you describe
that person and we've got the next
expression which is in hot water in hot
water basically means to be in trouble
so you can say something like don't
drink and drive
we've got cops on the block on the next
block you will be in hot water you will
be in trouble
don't do anything that gets you in hot
water it basically means to be in
trouble the next one is to be hot on
someone's heels
so this basically means to follow close
behind so when when thieves robbed a
bank they run away and the police in
most cases is hot on their heels which
means the police try to chase them so
they follow them close behind okay and
the last expression we've got for this
word is having the hots what does it
mean to have the hots when I say that I
have the hots for someone or I have the
hots for this person it basically means
that I am sexually or romantically
attracted to a certain individual okay
so if you like someone you
can say I want to go out with her I've
got the hots for her I am attracted to
her romantically or sexually or whatever
that is okay well that's it from me on
this lesson on expressions with the word
hot if you have any more expressions do
